document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 153–156. Pipiza aurantipes (Bigot, 1857): (153) visiting a flower of Loasa tricolor Ker Gawl, El Monte (Foto by Claudio Arancibia) and (154) dorsal view, male (photo by Patricia Henríquez). Scale bar = 1 mm. Pipiza triste (Philippi, 1865); (155) dorsal view, male, Isla Teja, Valdivia (photo by Andrés von Bennewitz), and (156) dorsal view, female (photo by Vicente Valdés). Black represents 0.6 mm.

bibRefCitation.author: Bigot, J. M. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bigot, J. M. F. (1857) Dipteres nouveaux provenant du Chili. Annales de la Societe Entomologique de France, Series 3, 5, 277 - 308.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“ Chile ” (T, ♀ , UMO )
.

Material examined.
Valparaíso : 1♂ , Quillota ,
25.X.1964
, Leg . ( MNHNCL )
;
1♂ , Quebrada de Cordova ,
24.X.1965
, Leg . Zapata ( IEUMCE )
;
1♂ , Quebrada verde,
29.IX.1964
, Leg . ( MNHNCL )
;
1♂ , Quebrada El Salto ,
25.X. 1964
, 526m Leg. ( MNHNCL )
;
1♂ , Llolleo ,
16.X.1966
, Leg . ( MNHNCL )
; Metropolitana:
2♂ , 1♀ , El Arrayán ,
XII.1956
, Leg . NN ( IEUMCE )
;
1♂ , Las Condes ,
12.XI.1944
, Leg. L.E. Peña ( INIA )
;
1♂ , Apoquindo , no date, Leg. NN ( IEUMCE )
;
1♀ , Peñalolen ,
12.I.1944
, Leg. L.E. Peña ( INIA )
;
1♀ , La Obra ,
23.XI.2018
, Leg . Rodrigo Bara- hona-Segovia ( PCRBS )
;
4♂ , 6♀ , El Canelo , no date, Leg . Ramírez ( IEUMCE )
;
1♂ , El Manzano ,
11.X.1981
, Leg . ( MNHNCL )
;
7♂ , Rio Clarillo National Park ,
19.XI.1953
, Leg. L.E. Peña ( CNC )
;
1♂ , 3♀ , Rinconada de Maipu , no date, Leg. NN ( MEUC )
; 1♂ , Cuesta Barriga, 11.X.1952 , Leg. J.
Herrera ( IEUMCE ); Ñuble
:
1♂ , Las Trancas ,
14–15.XII.1993
, Leg . G. & M. Wood ( CNC )
; La
Araucanía : 1♂ , Termas de Palguín ,
2.II.1966
, Leg. NN ( IEUMCE )
;
Los Ríos : 1♂ , Valdivia ,
17.X.1966
, Leg . Wagenknecht ( IEUMCE )
.
Chilean distribution. From Valparaíso to La Araucanía region ( Fig. 157 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to precordillera ecosystems ( 0–1000 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes. Philippi (1865) mentioned
Pipiza flavipes Philippi
as a junior synonym of
Sterphus flavipes
( Shannon & Aubertin 1933 ,
Thompson et al. 1976
), which was synonymized under
P. aurantipes (
Thompson et al. 1976
)
. Etcheverry (1963) and Thompson (1972b) comment that
P. flavipes
has no description and that the synonymy was based only on a catalog.
Pipiza flavipes
should be considered incertae sedis and therefore it was not incorporated into this study. Four specimens in the MNHNCL labeled as
P. flavipes
clearly belong to
P. aurantipes
. The examined material and distribution were added to the information of the latter species. The species has been observed in flowers of
Loasa triloba Dombey ex Juss.
(Claudio Arancibia, CSP record; Fig. 152 ).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 89,950 km 2 , AOO = 68 km 2 , 12 subpopulations and 15 localities.
